image.altText: Horses on a dirt paddock seen from the air.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian harness trainer Wayne Yole, the father of disqualified industry participants Ben and Tim Yole, is given until the end of the month to prove why he should be allowed to home, stable or train any horses.

title.children: Alleged breaches found during multi-agency search of Yole stables

image.altText: A young girl chopping vegetables with other kids in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: This kitchen is cooking up a plan to not only teach culinary skills, but to also inspire kids to develop — and keep — healthy eating habits.

title.children: Social enterprise kitchen hopes to inspire kids to cook and eat well

image.altText: Pauline Hanson with daughter Lee Hanson with some hot chips.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson, the leader of One Nation, has worked in politics for nearly three decades. Now, her daughter Lee is hoping to join her — running as a Senate candidate in southern Tasmania.

title.children: After years of urging, Pauline Hanson's daughter is running for One Nation

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: A new economic report commissioned by the Hobart City Council has found the stadium will deliver more than $140 million in economic impact to Hobart per year during the construction phase, and $178 million when operational.

title.children: New Hobart stadium report sought to address economic 'missed opportunity'

image.altText: Tasmania Police badge

props.synopsis: A man who worked as a doctor in Tasmania in the 1990s is extradited from New South Wales and charged with three counts of rape and three counts of indecent assault.

title.children: Former Tasmanian GP extradited to Hobart to face rape charges

image.altText: A closeup of hands securing a round red pipe cutter onto a copper pipe.

props.synopsis: Copper thieves are suspected of targeting vacant homes using real estate websites, leaving real estate agents and plumbers to clean up the mess and owners to foot the bill.

title.children: Copper thieves using real estate listings to target vacant properties

image.altText: Two seashells.

props.synopsis: A school student has discovered a "very, very rare" seashell during a school holiday session at the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery.

title.children: 8yo girl makes 'astounding' discovery of tiny, rare seashell at museum

image.altText: A chart shows the breakdown of energy generation over the course of a day, including coal, gas and renewables

props.synopsis: Our energy system is evolving at breakneck speed. Here we look at how our power grid works, what more renewables mean for energy prices, and how nuclear fits into the picture.

title.children: Coal is out, solar is in, does nuclear have a place? This illustrated guide explains

image.altText: Kristy Alleson

props.synopsis: In the upcoming federal election, there are five seats in regional Australia that could influence the overall result. Here's why they matter.

title.children: Five seats that could change the course of the election

image.altText: A graphic of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton cut-outs

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese campaigns in Victoria, where he will announce a funding boost to community language schools, while Peter Dutton starts the day in the Far North Queensland seat of Leichhardt. Follow live.

title.children: Campaigning resumes as election day nears

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Peter Dutton begins final stretch in Far North Queensland
PM takes the election campaign to Victoria

image.altText: A cute dog

props.synopsis: The beloved miniature dachshund, who disappeared on a South Australian island 529 days ago, has been found safe and well by wildlife rescuers.

title.children: Valerie the dachshund found 'fit and well' after 529 days on island

image.altText: A close up of a man's face

props.synopsis: We spoke to two experts to answer questions about what recourse the judiciary has when its authority is tested by the executive branch.

title.children: What happens if Trump officials defy the Supreme Court?

image.altText: Birds eye view of a group of men with shaved heads sitting closely together

props.synopsis: At CECOT in El Salvador there are no family visits, no access to the outdoors, no rehabilitation programs.

title.children: Inside the mega-prison where the only way out 'is in a coffin'

image.altText: A man in black is at the bottom centre of the image with two flags looming behind him

props.synopsis: It has been 11 years since Russia took control of the Crimean Peninsula. Here is what we know about what to expect next.

title.children: Why Zelenskyy won't give up Crimea

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage holding a gun holds his other arm up indicating someone should stop at a checkpoint

props.synopsis: The United Nations has called for calm from both sides days after a deadly attack in the region left 26 people dead.

title.children: India and Pakistan trade gunfire as UN calls for calm

image.altText: A young mum, smiling at the camera while holding her baby.

props.synopsis: Researchers say women are feeling under represented in politics and struggle to speak up about the issues that matter to them.

title.children: As voter priorities shift, some women feel ignored by male politicians

image.altText: a solo climber on Mount Everest during a storm

props.synopsis: As Nepal moves to reform safety on Mt Everest, some of the peak's most respected guides question whether the new rules will save lives.

title.children: 'Buyer beware' on Mt Everest as guides question new rules

image.altText: A man in a suit shakes hands with the pope as he sits on a flight.

props.synopsis: Ahead of Pope Francis's funeral, everyday people from Australia and neighbouring countries share the unique encounters and experiences they had with the pontiff.

title.children: 'He had the energy of a bull ant': Australians' unique pope encounters

image.altText: A man looking at a cassowary walking by.

props.synopsis: A devastating cyclone helped Kenn Parker build his rainforest home, and now his favourite neighbours are the cassowaries who come to visit with their chicks.

title.children: The house that Yasi built: One man's solitary life with the cassowaries

image.altText: A young man in a collared shirt and bulletproof vest sits in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Mr Mangione has pleaded not guilty to federal charges of gunning down health insurance executive Brian Thompson late last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty to killing healthcare CEO

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump holds up a chart with numbers showing tax rates changed to trading partners

props.synopsis: The US president said his Chinese counterpart called him and it was not a "sign of weakness" as Beijing quietly exempted some US good from import levies.

title.children: Donald Trump says Xi called, China denies tariffs talks are happening

image.altText: A composite photo of a man with dark hair, a woman with long dark hair and another man with dark hair.

props.synopsis: Labor has held Macnamara, which takes in Melbourne's inner south, for more than a century, but it's now an unpredictable three-way contest between Labor, the Greens and the Liberals.

title.children: Macnamara seems like a 'very safe' Labor seat. It's not

image.altText: A woman looks at her baby who she is holding aloft for the camera

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party holds the seat of Sturt on an ultra-thin margin. This is what voters are saying in the inner eastern suburbs electorate.

title.children: The talk on the street in South Australia's most marginal seat

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman with short black hair, graying at the roots wearing a pink polo shirt sitting in front of her home.

props.synopsis: When Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visited the NT community of Binjari to announce $4 billion to improve remote housing, the community were hopeful. But a year later, no new homes have been built.

title.children: From a tin shed in remote Binjari, Olivia waits on a $4bn housing promise

image.altText: Composite image of Alexei Popyrin and Daria Kasatkina.

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin and Chris O'Connell are knocked out of the Madrid Open, while Daria Kasatkina — who recently switched her allegiance to Australia — wins through to the round of 32.

title.children: Aussies produce mixed fortunes at Madrid Open

image.altText: Two men in firefighting uniforms stand in front of two red firetrucks.

props.synopsis: The transition from military service to a career in firefighting is a natural fit for many in the Australian Army, a former commando says, describing it as "going from one family to another".

title.children: 'From one family to another': Commando finds fresh start in firefighting

image.altText: A family on holiday at a theme park outside of Bigfoot's Cave

props.synopsis: Brooke Bottrell has been fairly tuned out this federal election as she tries to find mental health support for her kids. She says access to mental health care is an issue both sides of politics need to address.

title.children: Parent wants better mental health care for kids in 'missing middle'

image.altText: Bailey Smith points a finger after Cats beat Hawks.

props.synopsis: Geelong defender Zach Guthrie urges teammate Bailey Smith to continue playing on the edge, provided the high-profile midfielder's on-field antics do not become a distraction for the club.

title.children: Cats back 'energetic guy' Smith as Blues test looms

image.altText: Linda Reynolds smiling, in a dark suit jacket walking to court.

props.synopsis: Outgoing WA Senator Linda Reynolds is suing the Commonwealth over a payment it made to Brittany Higgins, which she claims gave validity to accusations her former staffer had made against her.

title.children: Linda Reynolds launches legal action against Commonwealth over Higgins payment

image.altText: Uncle Mark Brown

props.synopsis: The heckling at Melbourne’s Anzac Day service mirrors the long, quiet and painful exclusion of Black diggers from the national conversation.

title.children: The Neo-Nazi heckling at Melbourne's Anzac Day echoes our past pain

image.altText: Peter, who has a moustache, grins on stage with flowers and a large boarding pass to 'comedy stardom'

props.synopsis: RAW comedy has been running for almost 30 years, kickstarting the careers of Australia's up-and-coming stand-ups, including Ronny Chieng, Josh Thomas, Celia Pacquola and Hannah Gadsby.

title.children: The comedy contest that pushed Australia's biggest acts to stardom

image.altText: Pat Cummins smiles during an IPL match for Sunrisers Hyderabad.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins leads Sunrisers Hyderabad to a five-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings to revive his side's chances of reaching the Indian Premier League play-offs.

title.children: Cummins's Sunrisers Hyderabad score vital IPL win

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A woman who tried to intervene in an altercation in Victoria's north-east has died after being hit by a car. A male pedestrian has died in a separate road incident in Shepparton.

title.children: Two people killed in separate incidents on Victorian roads overnight

image.altText: an older woman with short blonde/grey hair in an apron standing in front of a commercial coffee machine

props.synopsis: At 64, Jan Lawlor is not your typical fast-food worker. While some women her age are in the workforce out of financial need, Jan is working for the love of it.

title.children: 'Nanny' works in youth-dominated fast food industry because she loves it

image.altText: A woman in a paint-splattered button down shirt looks upward while painting on a canvas.

props.synopsis: With a canvas strapped to her back atop her bike, artist Sophie Baker cuts an unusual figure in the Canberra bush — now artists like her are ditching the studio to embrace painting in the open air as part of a new festival.

title.children: 'Into the bush': Artists ditch the studio to embrace open air painting
